utils.auth

Class KeyManager

  • java.lang.Object
    • utils.auth.KeyManager

  • public class KeyManager
extends java.lang.Object
    Manager for the private and public keys of users and external apps

      key algorithm used

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      byte[] decryptKey(org.bson.types.ObjectId target, byte[] keyToDecrypt)
      Decrypt an encrypted key using the entities private key This operation will only work if the corresponding account has been unlocked before.
      byte[] encryptKey(byte[] publicKey, byte[] keyToEncrypt)
      encrypt a key with a given public key
      byte[] encryptKey(org.bson.types.ObjectId target, byte[] keyToEncrypt)
      encrypt a key with the target entities public key and return the encrypted key
      byte[] generateKeypairAndReturnPublicKey(org.bson.types.ObjectId target)
      Generate a new public/private key pair, store the private key in the database and return the public key This method will not add additional protection to the private key
      byte[] generateKeypairAndReturnPublicKey(org.bson.types.ObjectId target, java.lang.String passphrase)
      Generate a new public/private key pair, protect the private key with a passphrase, store it in db and return the public key.
      void lock(org.bson.types.ObjectId target)
      Remove a private key from memory
      void unlock(org.bson.types.ObjectId target, java.lang.String passphrase)
      Unlock a user or app instance account The account stays unlocked until lock is called for the account

    • Method Detail

      • encryptKey

        public byte[] encryptKey(org.bson.types.ObjectId target,
                byte[] keyToEncrypt)
                  throws EncryptionNotSupportedException,
                         InternalServerException
        encrypt a key with the target entities public key and return the encrypted key
        Parameters:
        target - id of user or app instance from which the public key should be used
        keyToEncrypt - the key to encrypt
        Returns:
        encrypted key
        Throws:
        EncryptionNotSupportedException
        InternalServerException

      • encryptKey

        public byte[] encryptKey(byte[] publicKey,
                byte[] keyToEncrypt)
                  throws EncryptionNotSupportedException,
                         InternalServerException
        encrypt a key with a given public key
        Parameters:
        publicKey - the public key that should be used for encryption
        keyToEncrypt - the key that shall be encrypted
        Returns:
        the encrypted keyToEncrypt
        Throws:
        EncryptionNotSupportedException
        InternalServerException

      • decryptKey

        public byte[] decryptKey(org.bson.types.ObjectId target,
                byte[] keyToDecrypt)
                  throws InternalServerException,
                         AuthException
        Decrypt an encrypted key using the entities private key This operation will only work if the corresponding account has been unlocked before.
        Parameters:
        target - the id of the user or application instance from which the private key should be used
        keyToDecrypt - the encrypted key that shall be decrypted
        Returns:
        the decrypted keyToDecrypt
        Throws:
        InternalServerException
        AuthException

      • generateKeypairAndReturnPublicKey

        public byte[] generateKeypairAndReturnPublicKey(org.bson.types.ObjectId target)
                                         throws InternalServerException
        Generate a new public/private key pair, store the private key in the database and return the public key This method will not add additional protection to the private key
        Parameters:
        target - id of user for whom the keypair should be generated
        Returns:
        public key
        Throws:
        InternalServerException

      • generateKeypairAndReturnPublicKey

        public byte[] generateKeypairAndReturnPublicKey(org.bson.types.ObjectId target,
                                       java.lang.String passphrase)
                                         throws InternalServerException
        Generate a new public/private key pair, protect the private key with a passphrase, store it in db and return the public key. This method will protect the generated private key with a passphrase.
        Parameters:
        target - id of user or application instance for which this keypair should be generated
        passphrase - passphrase to apply the the private key
        Returns:
        public key
        Throws:
        InternalServerException

      • unlock

        public void unlock(org.bson.types.ObjectId target,
          java.lang.String passphrase)
            throws InternalServerException
        Unlock a user or app instance account The account stays unlocked until lock is called for the account
        Parameters:
        target - id of user or app instance to unlock
        passphrase - the passphrase for the private key or null if no passphrase has been applied
        Throws:
        InternalServerException

      • lock

        public void lock(org.bson.types.ObjectId target)
          throws InternalServerException
        Remove a private key from memory
        Parameters:
        target - id of user or app instance for which the private key should be cleared
        Throws:
        InternalServerException
